programme.title: Eco India
programme.desc: Consumption of goods by people is drastically influencing environment. Eco India is a DW program entirely dedicated to Indian subcontinent and it looks at possibilities to strike a balance, and make consumption more sustainable, in such way to avoid point of no return. The program draws our attention to such essential aspects as being mindful about how much fuel, electricity, plastic, water we are using, so we can manage household budget and give a boost to climate change.

programme.title: In good shape
programme.desc: In Good Shape is the weekly health show on DW, entirely dedicated to health care. Find out everything about new medical treatments, alternative medicine, wellness, fitness, and nutrition. The shows hosts and guests discuss key topics with specialists, and offer opportunities to receive tips and tools for a healthy lifestyle directly from experts. Learn how natural remedies can help you stay healthier, how you can maintain a healthy diet, how to manage stress and how to improve your quality of life.

programme.title: Elukoha paastmine
programme.desc: This reality TV show follows Marty Raney and his two children, Matt Raney and Misty Bilodeau, who are successful homesteaders from the state of Alaska and have the skills needed to fish, hunt, raise livestock, and otherwise survive in an untamed landscape. Struggling homesteaders across the country call these experts to help them save their homesteads and become self-sufficient while they teach them the necessary skills to survive the wilderness.

programme.title: Aardekutid
programme.desc: Meet modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard. With demanding customers, high turnover, and one of the biggest decorative salvage yards in the UK, Drew is constantly on the road, crisscrossing the country in search of derelict gems and forgotten remnants. Drew loves the thrill of the hunt and while he gets his hands dirty in the countrys architectural backwaters, his team of restorers is back at the shop giving old and rare finds a new lease on life!

programme.title: K√µige ohtlikum saak
programme.desc: A documentary chronicling real life the adventures of one of the most deadliest professions in the world. Follow Alaskan crab fishermen as they face 40-foot waves and intense discomfort with freezing temperatures as they fish in the Bering sea. Sacrificing tooth and nail to catch the seasonal delicacies to later sell and trade on land. Witness the dangers these fisher men face as they battle against the sea, and experience how caution is a crucial part of staying alive.

programme.title: Automuujad
programme.desc: Buy, repair and restore and then resell a classic car in order to make profit- this is what Wheeler Dealers is about. The budget is limited, though you can see some exclusive and rare cars. Mike Brewer, a British dealer chooses the car carefully and hands it over to the mechanic, first Edd China, later Ant Anstead to be fixed and upgraded. The hosts are real masters of their trade, it seems they can bring life even to a piece of metal. It does not matter if you are a life-long car enthusiast or do not even have a driving license you will admire the results of hard work from the beginning to the end of the long uneasy restoring process.

programme.title: Kuidas see tehtud on?
programme.desc: Have you ever wondered how things that surround us every day are produced? Find out about the whole process from the beginning to the end in a documentary television series How Its Made. The series demonstrates how various items like clothing and accessories, food, industrial products, cars, musical instruments and many more are manufactured. Who would have thought how exciting it would be to watch a cupcake, formula 1 race car or gummy vitamins being made?

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers World Tour
programme.desc: In their most ambitious project yet, Mike and Elvis aim to build a tribute to Paddy Hopkirks winning 1964 Mini Cooper. Will it cross the finish line?

programme.title: Asphalt Cowboys
programme.desc: Hauling a heavy load in gigantic trucks is no joke, and this reality series follows truckers, also known as asphalt cowboys, as they earn their money transporting heavy goods across the European continent. Battling the elements, strict time constraints, and the loneliness of being away from home, these truckers fire up their engines and waste no time on the road, ensuring their clients goods arrive on time and in one piece!

programme.title: Asphalt Cowboys
programme.desc: Hauling a heavy load in gigantic trucks is no joke, and this reality series follows truckers, also known as asphalt cowboys, as they earn their money transporting heavy goods across the European continent. Battling the elements, strict time constraints, and the loneliness of being away from home, these truckers fire up their engines and waste no time on the road, ensuring their clients goods arrive on time and in one piece!

programme.title: Mighty Truckers
programme.desc: This real-life road show follows the lives of twenty truckers from four different countries - Poland, Italy, Germany and the Netherlands. These unique and diverse characters will show the viewers the world of transport, introducing them with the profession of "truck driver". Who are these men and women who ensure that we get various goods on time day and night? What makes them choose the life on the road? This show will answer these questions in an "up close and personal" portrait of trucker life.

programme.title: Mighty Truckers

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Expert craftsmen are bringing Drew Pritchards finds back to life and restore them to their former glory. Drew hunts for treasures such as derelict gems and forgotten remnants across the country. And then he and his team do the restoration turning trash to gold, so that worn objects become shining gems for which Drews customers want to pay a lot of money. All kinds of items can and will be restored, starting from a century-old suitcase to an ancient coffee machine, from a ravaged carousel horse to a large railway clock.

programme.title: Kullapalavik
programme.desc: Gold Rush is a reality television series that follows the placer gold mining efforts of various family-run mining companies in boundless north of America. The series focuses on the work process in the conditions of permafrost and working relations between the participants. The show has 10 seasons altogether. In some episodes participants start the adventure and travel to Alaska to search for gold because of financial issues. They do not have any previous experience and have to learn on the job. Then there appears several gold mining teams that compete with each other. In some episodes the teams move to South America. Admire the courage and determination of the team members in their unstoppable desire to become rich.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Did you know that Australia accounts for over 95% of the worlds supply of opal? Well, these miners do, and in this documentary series we follow groups of brave and persevering souls as they scour the land in search of the precious and highly valuable gemstone. With many of the mines located in the desolately deserted Outback, the crews must face some of Australias most treacherous landscapes if they are to hit the jackpot. The six crews have to weigh up the consequences in these old and hazardous mines, often risking their lives in search of opal wealth, not to mention preventing opportunistic thieves from snatching their hauls.

programme.title: Pagasi lahingud
programme.desc: In the Sunshine State, Billy seeks a big payday from a buyer in need of a collectible car, while the Martins and Mark look for cheap vehicles to flip for big profits.

programme.title: Pagasi lahingud
programme.desc: Featuring professional buyers including antique dealers, a production designer and an eCommerce expert, these expert buyers travel around the world to lost baggage auctions, estate auctions and police auctions to find the hidden treasure and items left behind or siezed by customs in order to make the greatest profit. This American docu-reality series created by The Travel Channel in 2012. Finding contents in baggage such as a bronze sculpture, jewellery including 18 karat gold and a legendary belt, these professionals prove why they have a name for themselves in their industry, finding hidden gems in hidden places.

programme.title: Border Control
programme.desc: Going through customs can be a stressful experience for most people, even more so if youre attempting to smuggle drugs or weapons into the country. Follow the efforts of the Security and Customs Services at the border of Spain, as they work hard to keep their country safe from criminals. Whether its drugs, weapons or even terrorism, theres a lot of things security have to consider in order to make sure all threats are handled properly. These security forces are always hot on the trail of suspicious activity, in the air, on land or away at sea.

programme.title: Border Control

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Expert craftsmen are bringing Drew Pritchards finds back to life and restore them to their former glory. Drew hunts for treasures such as derelict gems and forgotten remnants across the country. And then he and his team do the restoration turning trash to gold, so that worn objects become shining gems for which Drews customers want to pay a lot of money. All kinds of items can and will be restored, starting from a century-old suitcase to an ancient coffee machine, from a ravaged carousel horse to a large railway clock.

programme.title: Aardekutid
programme.desc: Meet modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard. With demanding customers, high turnover, and one of the biggest decorative salvage yards in the UK, Drew is constantly on the road, crisscrossing the country in search of derelict gems and forgotten remnants. Drew loves the thrill of the hunt and while he gets his hands dirty in the countrys architectural backwaters, his team of restorers is back at the shop giving old and rare finds a new lease on life!

programme.title: Elukoha paastmine
programme.desc: This reality TV show follows Marty Raney and his two children, Matt Raney and Misty Bilodeau, who are successful homesteaders from the state of Alaska and have the skills needed to fish, hunt, raise livestock, and otherwise survive in an untamed landscape. Struggling homesteaders across the country call these experts to help them save their homesteads and become self-sufficient while they teach them the necessary skills to survive the wilderness.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland travel across the United Kingdom to uncover classic cars to buy, restore and sell on for a profit. The pair scour garages, barns and facilities to discover collectible cars which include the likes of the Morris Minor Traveller, Jaguar XJS, Rover P6 and a BMW 635 CSI among many others. The combination of Drews expertise of negotiation and deal-making and Pauls extensive mechanical knowledge makes them a formidable team ready to tackle anything challenging that comes their way.

programme.title: Kuidas see tehtud on?
programme.desc: Have you ever wondered how things that surround us every day are produced? Find out about the whole process from the beginning to the end in a documentary television series How Its Made. The series demonstrates how various items like clothing and accessories, food, industrial products, cars, musical instruments and many more are manufactured. Who would have thought how exciting it would be to watch a cupcake, formula 1 race car or gummy vitamins being made?

programme.title: Automuujad
programme.desc: Buy, repair and restore and then resell a classic car in order to make profit- this is what Wheeler Dealers is about. The budget is limited, though you can see some exclusive and rare cars. Mike Brewer, a British dealer chooses the car carefully and hands it over to the mechanic, first Edd China, later Ant Anstead to be fixed and upgraded. The hosts are real masters of their trade, it seems they can bring life even to a piece of metal. It does not matter if you are a life-long car enthusiast or do not even have a driving license you will admire the results of hard work from the beginning to the end of the long uneasy restoring process.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Motorbike enthusiast Henry Cole and expert Sam Lovegrove travel around the UK to explore peoples sheds searching for some automotive bargains. They purchase all kinds of old cars, bikes, jeeps, tractors and other vehicles in order to renovate them and sell after the rehabilitation work is over. The old vehicles are restored and given second life. It is a risky business and the two always wonder if they manage to make profit this time.

programme.title: Christian Scott - The Centennial Trilogy
programme.desc: In just a few years, young trumpet player Christian Scott has become synonymous with a new jazz generation. He shakes up the conventions of jazz by taking the genre to new horizons and reaching a wider audience. No doubt, at 33 years old, Christian Scott is already forging his own path. After each record release, he seems even more determined to challenge the rules of jazz with his own avant-garde style. At his 2018 show at La Cooperative de Mai, Christian Scott celebrates 100 years of jazz with the program "The Centennial Trilogy." Expect a unique performance in an intimate theatre setting, shot in native 4K!

programme.title: Stingray PausePlay
programme.desc: We Pause and chat with local and international artists to get an in-depth look at their lives and music, they Play some amazing music in these, one-of-a-kind, live sessions! These portraits of artists, concerts and festivals give a good impression of the jazz world. Both famous and less famous jazz artists will give a new insight in their life. DJAZZ asked them why they wrote that special song, what was the first record they bought and what is his or her most precious musical memory. The festival portraits are beautiful reports filmed at the most special jazz festivals and concerts. They revive the memory of the festival, the music and the experience.

programme.title: Burton Greene - OTO
programme.desc: Legendary free jazz pianist Burton Greene rose to fame in New York Citys free jazz scene of the 1960s. Exploring various spontaneous improvisational styles, Greene performs live at Cafe OTO in London, UK.

programme.title: DJAZZ Portrait
programme.desc: These portraits of artists, concerts and festivals provide a good picture of the jazz world. They are portraits of well-known and less known jazz artists who give us an insight into their lives amongst other things, DJAZZ asked them why they wrote that particular song, what was the first record this musician bought and what his or her most cherished musical memory is. The festival portraits are beautiful reports of the most special jazz festivals and concerts. They revive the festival with the music and experience.

programme.title: Lady Day - The Many Faces Of Billie Holiday
programme.desc: Lady Day: The Many Faces of Billie Holiday tells us the story of one of jazzs greatest singers ever. Although Billie Holiday lived a life filled with tragedy, this documentary focuses more on her achievements as a singer and her exceptional ability to convey emotions through her voice, rather than going into detail about her drug and alcohol addictions and destructive relationships. Lady Day: The Many Faces of Billie Holiday features several brilliant performances of Billie Holiday. Colleagues such as Carmen McRae, Annie Ross, Mal Waldron, Buck Clayton, Harry "Sweets" Edison, and Milt Gabler offer their first-hand perspectives.

programme.title: Jazzahead!
programme.desc: Annual trade fair, exhibition, and festival jazzahead! is one of the international jazz communitys most important events. Hosted in Bremen, Germany, jazzahead! brings together musicians, bookers, agents, organizers, jazz experts, and music enthusiasts at the worlds largest jazz event. In 2022, jazzahead! paid special attention to Canadas jazz scene and invited forty jazz acts from all over the world to perform over the course of three days. Contemporary flamenco musician Antonio Lizana is among the artists presenting their music at jazzahead! 2022. In a genre dominated by percussionists and guitarists, saxophonist and vocalist Lizana steps away from the mainstream. His live shows have been described a "breath-taking journey from flamenco roots to contemporary jazz", and he is known for his collaborations with pianists Arturo OFarrill and Chano Dom√≠nguez, singer-guitarist Alejandro Sanz, bass guitar legend Marcus Miller, and jazz funk collective Snarky Puppy. At jazzahead!, Antonio Lizana is accompanied by Daniel Garcia Diego (piano and backing vocals), Arin Keshishi (electric bass and backing vocals), Shayan Fathi (drums), and El Mawi (flamenco dancing and backing vocals).

programme.title: Jazzahead!
programme.desc: Annual trade fair, exhibition, and festival jazzahead! is one of the international jazz communitys most important events. Hosted in Bremen, Germany, jazzahead! brings together musicians, bookers, agents, organizers, jazz experts, and music enthusiasts at the worlds largest jazz event. In 2022, jazzahead! paid special attention to Canadas jazz scene and invited forty jazz acts from all over the world to perform over the course of three days. Among the performing bands is the Itamar Erez Quartet. Pianist and guitarist Itamar Erez was born in Israel, studied composition in Cologne and London, then went back to Jerusalem. Currently based in Vancouver, the guitarist-composers music has a sensitivity that touches listeners profoundly. His unique sound blends Middle Eastern musics delicacy, the freedom found in jazz, and the passion of flamenco. Erez is accompanied by clarinetist Francois Houle, bassist Jeff Gammon and drummer Kevin Romain.

programme.title: The MotorMusic Jazz Sessions
programme.desc: The MotorMusic Studios in Mechelen, Belgium, attract many great musicians to the city. A wide variety of visiting international jazz musicians share their art of making jazz music with us in the DJAZZ series Belgium Sessions. In these sessions, some of Europes finest musicians perform their own, original music. This episode MotorMusic invites the jazz trio WRaP!, consisting of singer Barbara Wiernik, guitarist Alain Pierre, and Chet Bakers former bassist: Jean-Louis Rassinfosse. The trio plays one of their most beautiful compositions of Endless. In this fine composition, Wierniks beautiful voice, Pierres crystal chords of the 12-string guitar, and the warm sounds of the contrabass come to full bloom.

programme.title: Da P√° Virada Sessions
programme.desc: The Da P√° Virada Sessions series presents the best musicians of contemporary Brazilian jazz, and beyond. Filmed in Sao Paulo, each session offers a unique experience by giving a fresh look into Brazils music scene. The artists for each session are selected in consultation with Stingray DJAZZs music editor. One of the bands taking part in this episode is a foursome that pays tribute to pioneering m√∫sica popular brasileira vocalist Elis Regina: vocalist Vanessa Moreno, bassist Fi Marostica, Rhodes and keyboard player Tiago Costa, and drummer Jonatas Sansao honor the legendary Brazilian singer by performing famous pieces and hidden gems from her repertoire.

programme.title: Summer Night Music - Love Songs
programme.desc: In Summer Night Music - Love Songs, artists from all over the world contribute their favourite love songs to an unusual and exciting event uniting classical, jazz, and world music. Among the classical musicians are the Gewandhaus Orchestra, cellist Mischa Maisky, and The Kings Singers. Other world stars include jazz vocalist Dee Dee Bridgewater and flamenco cantaora Mayte Martin. The variety of musicians and genres appeals to a wide audience, aiming to create a grand open-air atmosphere that every music lover will remember.

programme.title: Jimmy Witherspoon Quartet and Rozaa Wortham 1985
programme.desc: Estival has been an annual jazz festival since 1977 and takes place in the Italian speaking part of Switzerland named Lugano. Estival offers an exhilarating and especially a surprising line-up that focuses in a particular world of modern music with rich sounds. At Estival, promoting the splendor, tolerance and existence between different cultures is supreme. Hereby Jimmy Witherspoon and Rozaa Wortham, two exceptionally special jazz musicians. Rozaa Wortham kicks off with the Jimmy Witherspoon Quartet. Swinging and energetic she sings It Dont Mean A Thing. Jimmy Witherspoon, known for the song Aint Nobodys Business, starts his performance with pleasant layed-back blues.

programme.title: DJAZZ Portrait
programme.desc: These portraits of artists, concerts and festivals provide a good picture of the jazz world. They are portraits of well-known and less known jazz artists who give us an insight into their lives amongst other things, DJAZZ asked them why they wrote that particular song, what was the first record this musician bought and what his or her most cherished musical memory is. The festival portraits are beautiful reports of the most special jazz festivals and concerts. They revive the festival with the music and experience.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Count Basie and his Orchestra live in Charleroi
programme.desc: Count Basie is one of the most important bandleaders of the swing era. With the exception of a brief period in the early 50s, he led a big band from 1935 until his death almost 50 years later. Basies orchestra was characterized by a light, swinging rhythm section that he led from the piano, lively ensemble work, and generous soloing. Basie was not a composer like Duke Ellington or an important soloist like Benny Goodman. His instrument was his band, which was considered the epitome of swing and deeply influenced jazz. In this 1961 concert recording, Count Basie takes the stage in Charleroi.

programme.title: Chamber Music
programme.desc: Hailing from a long tradition of Malian kora players, Ballake Sissoko has worked with renowned musicians such as Toumani Diabate and Taj Mahal. He met the French born Vincent Segal by chance, and the two began jamming together, uncertain of what kind of music might result. As a former member of the French National Orchestra, Segals Western classical training does not prevent him from exploring a wide variety of extended techniques, rendering his cello a flexible partner to Sissokos kora. A childhood spent in the Pigalle district of Paris surrounded by immigrant communities exposed Segal to African music from an early age. As such, he possesses a natural sensitivity to Sissokos West-African style. The concert shows a brilliant interplay between the two musicians and combines the several worlds of jazz, Malian and classical music.

programme.title: John Coltrane
programme.desc: The mere mention of the name John Coltrane evokes a deeply emotional, often spiritual response from even the most casual jazz fan. Dexter Gordon was a fantastic saxophonist. Miles Davis was a genius. Coltrane stood above - he was a visionary, a saint-like figure. By the standards of most jazz musicians, his life was uneventful. Sure, he had a heroin habit for a while, and Miles Davis punched him, but once hed experienced the "spiritual awakening" described in the liner notes of his 1965 album A Love Supreme, he dedicated himself to his music with extreme single-mindedness. This broadcast of Coltranes 1965 performance at the short-lived Belgian jazz festival in Comblain-la-Tour features Tranes classic quartet with Elvin Jones (drums), Jimmy Garrison (bass) and McCoy Tyner (piano).

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: North Sea Jazz Classics
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festivals staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1988, acclaimed Brazilian singer and pianist Tania Maria performed with bassist Leonard Traversa and drummer Kim Plainfield at the North Sea Jazz Festival in The Hague. Maria is known for her energetic personality and unique style of singing that draws from a variety of jazz, Latin and pop traditions.

programme.title: Paradox Live
programme.desc: Innovative contemporary jazz and improvised music, the search for modernity, mind blowing sounds, rock and pop‚Ä¶ Indeed PARADOX Tilburg goes beyond jazz, crossing musical boundaries into the unknown soundscapes of electronic music. Indie artists, blues veterans and jazz superstars all pour their hearts and souls at the Paradox. From young, local talents to top national and international artists, PARADOX Tilburg is the most intimate jazz club in the Netherlands, with a devoted audience from all across Europe. In their TV show PARADOX LIVE you get a taste of the greatest concerts and interviews with artists from all around the world. This episode of PARADOX LIVE presents the amazing Dutch jazzband BRUUT led by saxophone player Maarten Hoogenhuis!

programme.title: Jazzahead!
programme.desc: Annual trade fair, exhibition, and festival jazzahead! is one of the international jazz communitys most important events. Hosted in Bremen, Germany, jazzahead! brings together musicians, bookers, agents, organizers, jazz experts, and music enthusiasts at the worlds largest jazz event. In 2022, jazzahead! paid special attention to Canadas jazz scene and invited forty jazz acts from all over the world to perform over the course of three days. Possibly the largest ensemble performing at jazzahead! 2022, the Fuchsthone Orchestra was founded by conductors and composers Christina Fuchs and Caroline Thon in 2018. This spectacular Cologne-based orchestra, which is comprised of twenty-two outstanding artists, offers an exciting experimental new sound that stretches the conventional limits of the traditional big band. The rhythm section of pianist Laia Genc, guitarist Andreas Wahl, bassist Alexander Morsey, drummer Jens Duppe, and electronics artist Eva Popplein is augmented by saxophonists Roger Hanschel, Theresia Philipp, Matthew Halpin, Jens Bockamp, and Susanne Weidinger, trumpeters Christian Mehler, Matthias Knoop, John-Dennis Renken, and Matthias Bergmann, trombonists Philipp Schittek, Matthias Schuller, Matthias Muche, and Wolf Schenk, vocalist Filippa Gojo, and violinist Zuzana Leharov√†.

programme.title: Elliot Galvin Trio - November Music
programme.desc: The annual international festival November Music was first held in 1993. Since then, the festival has been promoting contemporary music across various locations in the Netherlands city s-Hertogenbosch. Its 2018 edition included jazz, avant-garde, world and electronic music, sound installations, modern opera and theatre, as well as various interdisciplinary performances. One of the performers in 2018, the pianist Elliot Galvin is a member of the young UK jazz group Dinosaur. Performing with his trio, the gifted musician has been compared to Django Bates for his maverick imagination and ability to blend influences from all over the world.

programme.title: Obatal√†
programme.desc: Legendary Cuban pianist Chucho Valdes brought his band "Jazz Bat√° 2" to the Malta Jazz Festival on July 19, 2019. The air was thick with anticipation as Valdes took to the stage, revisiting the small-group concept of his mythical 1972 Cuban album Jazz Bat√°. The bat√° repertoire - the deep classical music of West Africa - permeates Valdes piano solos throughout the concert. Valdess band consists of Dreiser Durruthy (Batas and vocals), Yaroldy Abreu (percussions and vocals), Abraham Mansfarroll (percussion), Ramon Vazquez Martirena-Bajo (bass guitar). They delivered a performance that reverberated through the historic island.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Paradox Live
programme.desc: Innovative contemporary jazz and improvised music, the search for modernity, mind blowing sounds, rock and pop‚Ä¶ Indeed PARADOX Tilburg goes beyond jazz, crossing musical boundaries into the unknown soundscapes of electronic music. Indie artists, blues veterans and jazz superstars all pour their hearts and souls at the Paradox. From young, local talents to top national and international artists, PARADOX Tilburg is the most intimate jazz club in the Netherlands, with a devoted audience from all across Europe. In their TV show PARADOX LIVE you get a taste of the greatest concerts and interviews with artists from all around the world. This episode of PARADOX LIVE presents the amazing Dutch pianist Wolfert Brederode.

programme.title: North Sea Jazz Classics
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festivals staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1982, American trumpeter and composer Wynton Marsalis and his quintet performed at the North Sea Jazz Festival in The Hague. Accompanied by brother/saxophonist Branford Marsalis, drummer Jeff Watts, bassist Phil Bauer and pianist Kenny Kirkland, 20-year-old Wynton Marsalis shows his pedigree as a former member of Art Blakeys Jazz Messengers.

programme.title: BIRDtv
programme.desc: Rotterdams BIRD is a club, cafe and restaurant with a live music programme thats deeply rooted in jazz, and also branches out towards soul, funk, hip-hop and electronic music as well. Its name "BIRD" refers to the nickname of the legendary New York jazz saxophonist, bebop co-founder Charlie Parker (1920-1955). BIRD serves Neapolitan pizzas, good wines, no-nonsense beers and an all-round metropolitan rawness. Since 2014, this urban jazz club and DJAZZ.tv have been collaborating for a series of music programmes: BIRD.tv, allowing you to experience the best BIRD concerts and interviews as from the first row! This episode is a fantastic registration of the after party of the North Sea Jazz Festival: Boogieball. This mega jam session is a great coming together of, amongst others, bassist Bootsy Collins, guitarist Fl√°vio Silva, and drummer/vocalist Sheila E.

programme.title: Seine Sessions
programme.desc: The term "jam-session" was coined in the 1920s when black and white musicians gathered in smoke-filled bars after their respective concerts to enjoy the kind of jazz they could not play in traditional sets. Bing Crosby was a regular at these sessions, and had fun marking the first and third beats of musical phrases by clapping hands, which the musicians call "jammin the beat". Today, the Seine Sessions revive the happy years of "jam sessions", while the cream of jazz, blues, gipsy and funk Parisian scenes occurs on the boards of the legendary restaurant and jazz club Le Reservoir. Titled "Legendary Jazz", this episode hosted by Eddy King features unique performances by artists playing together for the first time, and interviews with Steve McCraven, Oona Guino, Rodolphe Lauretta, and many others.

programme.title: The Morgenland Festival
programme.desc: Since 2005, the Morgenland Festival of Osnabrueck has dedicated itself to the fascinating music culture of the Near and Middle East. From traditional and classical music to avant-garde, jazz, and rock, the festival program also features art, such as visual arts, dance, and theatre of interdisciplinary projects. Bursting with sounds that could only be described as magical, "MCO" features the Syrian Expat Philharmonic Orchestra under conductor Naci √ñzgu√ß. Of Turkish origin, √ñzgu√ß was raised by two opera singers, who opened the doors of a musical career.

programme.title: Artvark Saxophone Quartet and Ntjam Rosie
programme.sub-title: Artvark Saxophone Quartet and Ntjam Rosie: Homelands
programme.desc: Homelands is a collaboration between Artvark Saxophone Quartet and Cameroonian-Dutch singer Ntjam Rosie. The music is inspired by both traditional and modern music from Ntjams home country Cameroon, (Manu Dibango and Richard Bona) as well as by an Afro-European blend of soul, jazz, gospel and world music. Using unorthodox sounds as the basis of their compositions, Artvark continues to be radical, experimenting with alternative ways of playing the sax. For this project, they explore the world of electronics and effects to create new sounds. Ntjams role is divers. She is the quartets fifth instrument, recites spoken word, plays (vocal) percussion, forms duos or trios with the saxophones and accompanies the quartet on her guitar. She performs texts in English as well as in French, one of Cameroons official languages, and sings in Bulu, her mother tongue.

programme.title: North Sea Jazz Classics
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festivals staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1979, legendary big band leader and pianist Count Basie brought his famous big band to the North Sea Jazz Festival in The Hague to perform two sets. Basie, whose minimalist pianism and blues-oriented swing style had cemented his popularity as early as the 1930s, was in the midst of a European tour and had recorded his live album "On the Road" the previous night in Montreux, Switzerland. Here is the second of two sets recorded at the festival in 1979.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Ella Fitzgerald in Brussels
programme.sub-title: Ella Fitzgerald in Brussels: The American Songbook
programme.desc: Ella Fitzgerald: Live in "57" features "The First Lady Of Song" in a distinct performance. Its the earliest known complete concert of Ella to be captured on film. Shot in Belgium, this 1957 concert sees her performing with jazz greats Ray Brown, Herb Ellis, Jo Jones and the legendary Oscar Peterson on classics such as "Lullaby Of Birdland" and It Dont Mean A Thing (If It Aint Got That Swing). Although she wanted to be a dancer at first, Ella Fitzgerald already listened to recordings of Louis Armstrong, Bing Crosby and The Boswell Sisters at an early age. After her debut at an amateur talent show in 1934, Ella joined Chick Webbs Orchestra with which she recorded several hits; after Webb died, she became the leader of the orchestra. In the late 1940s, Ella Fitzgerald became known as the First Lady of Song, with her wide vocal range of three octaves. The American jazz singer was particularly appreciated for her pure tone, intonation and phrasing, and unparalleled improvisational abilities. In a career that spanned close to 60 years, Fitzgerald sold 40 million albums and won 13 Grammy Awards, mainly for her definitive interpretations of the Great American Songbook.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Da P√° Virada Sessions
programme.desc: The Da P√° Virada Sessions series presents the best musicians of contemporary Brazilian jazz, and beyond. Filmed and curated in Sao Paulo by director and presenter Dani Gurgel and producer and engineer Thiago Rabello, each session offers a unique experience by giving a fresh look into Brazils music scene. The artists for each session are selected in consultation with Stingray DJAZZs music editor. Drawing from her Brazilian roots, upcoming vocalist Fran Nobrega is poring todays underground scene to bring us the latest trends in forro and popular Brazilian music. Her album "A flor e o Tempo" has won her a strong cult following, and her performances exude positive energy: get ready to dance to Nobregas exciting set!

programme.title: Trio Chemirani
programme.desc: The veritable tombak virtuosos of Trio Chemirani, consisting of Chemirani Senior and Juniors, enrapture the Festival de Saintes. The tombak is a Persian percussion instrument, but its rhythms are universal. The Trio Chemiranis music is accessible to all and will certainly resound with each listener. The members of the trio, Djamchid Chemirani (born in Teheran in 1942) and his two sons and pupils Keyvan and Bijan, are living in France. Their concert performances bring them all over the world, as they explore the endless potential of their Persian percussion instruments. The trio finds also inspiration in Mediterranean modal music and jazz. These three musicians, who might well be thought of as poets are in search of a common language that connects several cultures.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: WOMEX 2018
programme.desc: Since 1994, World Music Expo (WOMEX) has been attracting musicians, agents, a great number of press agencies, as well as media companies from all over the world. Its main exposition event has been held in various locations throughout Europe, including Berlin, Brussels, Marseille, Stockholm, Seville, Cardiff, and Budapest. In 2018, WOMEX was held in Las Palmas, Gran Canaria. One of its showcase participants, Bakolo Music International, represents the pioneers of the golden age of Congolese rumba. The singer, guitarist and grand survivor Nzofu Moko Buele, known to all as Bikunda, is carrying on a torch first lit in 1948 by "Papa" Wend Kolosoy, the "father of Congolese Rumba" and composer of the first Rumba hit song, Marie-Louise.

programme.title: jazzahead! 2022
programme.desc: Annual trade fair, exhibition, and festival jazzahead! is one of the international jazz communitys most important events. Hosted in Bremen, Germany, jazzahead! brings together musicians, bookers, agents, organizers, jazz experts, and music enthusiasts at the worlds largest jazz event. In 2022, jazzahead! paid special attention to Canadas jazz scene and invited forty jazz acts from all over the world to perform over the course of three days. One of the ensembles appearing at jazzahead! 2022 is baritone saxophonist and composer Kira Linns sextet, consisting of three wind instruments and a rhythm section. The band combines the acoustic sound of various wind instruments with the electronic sound of electric bass, synthesizers and Rhodes and electronic effects. Composer Kira Linn (on baritone saxophone and bass clarinet) is accompanied by Nino Wenger (alto saxophone, flute), Christopher Kunz (tenor and soprano saxophone), keyboardist Lukas GroSSmann, electric bassist Freek Mulder, and drummer Johannes Koch.

programme.title: jazzahead! 2023
programme.desc: Annual trade fair, exhibition, and festival jazzahead! is one of the international jazz communitys most important events. Hosted in Bremen, Germany, jazzahead! brings together musicians, bookers, agents, organizers, jazz experts, and music enthusiasts at the worlds largest jazz event. In 2023, jazzahead! paid special attention to Germanys jazz scene and invited thirty jazz acts from all over the world to perform over the course of three days. Among the artists presenting themselves at jazzahead! 2023 is Belgian-Japanese piano wizard Alex Koo. In his brand new Etudes for Piano, composed for and commissioned by BOZAR Brussels, he shows how his passion for jazz and classical music merge perfectly, like a marriage between Debussy, Chopin, Reich, and Rachmaninov on the one hand, and Keith Jarrett, Craig Taborn, Brian Eno, and Philip Glass on the other.

programme.title: Ryan Porter and The West Coast Get Down - BIRD
programme.desc: Los Angeles-born saxophonist Kamasi Washington and trombonist Ryan Porter co-founded West Coast Get Down - a musical collective fusing jazz and funk with hip-hop. It is partly because of this collective that jazz saw a resurgence in Los Angeles, subtly eclipsing the long-established jazz mecca of the world, New York City. The two musicians join forces and take the vibes of Los Angeles to jazz club BIRD in Rotterdam, the Netherlands.

programme.title: Anita Oday Live in Sweden 1963
programme.desc: Anita ODay boasts two wonderful concerts from 1963 and 1970 that present the "jazz singer supreme" in impeccable form. ODays horn-based approach to singing is in full effect throughout both shows including stand-out renditions in each show of audience favorites "Tea For Two" and "Sweet Georgia Brown" (both reprised from her triumphant appearance at the 1958 Newport Jazz Festival.) This show is a fitting testimony to one of jazz musics true originals and shows unequivocally why she is ranked in the top tier of vocalists along with Ella Fitzgerald, Sarah Vaughan, and Billie Holiday.

programme.title: Don Cherrys "Multikulti"
programme.desc: Trumpeter Don Cherry was a musician of great versatility, creating an endless variety of styles and influencing generations of musicians. Multikulti presents a never-before heard mixture of international sounds, from mainstream jazz to reggae, in his first collaboration with the amazing Peter Apfelbaum, one of the most in-demand performers at jazz festivals all over the world.

programme.title: Jazz √† Vienne
programme.desc: Jazz √† Vienne is one of the worlds most prestigious jazz festivals. Ever since 1981, it has attracted a mix of jazz legends and exciting newcomers, with many of them playing return engagements. Each year welcomes outstanding international stars to the historical Le The√¢tre Antique to impress and inspire their audiences. In 2018, Tunisian composer Dhafer Youssef alternated between his hypnotic voice and masterful oud playing at Jazz √† Vienne. His stunning abilities have to be heard to be believed. He is joined by bassist Matt Brewer and drummer Aaron Parks.

programme.title: Festival Vue sur la Rel√®ve
programme.sub-title: Festival Vue sur la Rel√®ve: SHPIK
programme.desc: Montreals very own jazz group SHPIK offers a bold and impressionistic music, drawing its inspirations from jazz, nature, and film. Evoking the great outdoors, self-discovery, and navigating between the immense and the infinitely small, this first album offers an intricate musical journey that is both energetic and reflective. Consisting of pianist and composer Arnaud Spick-Saucier, bassist Etienne Dextraze, drummer Philippe Lussier-Baillargeon, and saxophonist/flutist Alex Dodier, SHPIK has performed at famous jazz events, including the Montreal International Jazz Festival. Do yourself a favour by not missing this extraordinary breath of fresh air.

programme.title: November Music
programme.desc: November Music in s-Hertogenbosch has been the Dutch festival for contemporary new music since 1993. The festival offers a great combination of contemporary compositions and experimental pop, sound art, non-Western music, jazz, and improvised music. The closing concert of the 2016 edition is a good example of this musicals richness, hereby the fantastic young trio of composer and pianist Rembrandt Frerichs play together with Cello8ctet Amsterdam and renowned Iranian tar player Hossein Aliz√¢deh. Dutch pianist Rembrandt Frerichs studied in New York and lived in Cairo for several years. His music has the drive of American jazz and the lyricism of Eastern music, interspersed with recognizable elements from the chamber music of Claude Debussy and Maurice Ravel. The combination of Frerichs with the Cello8ctet and Aliz√¢deh is unique, as their music is a miracle of organic creativity, a perfectioned example of fusion between music from the old and the new world.

programme.title: Louis Armstrong
programme.desc: Following a highly successful small-group jazz concert at New York Town Hall on May 17, 1947, Armstrongs manager Joe Glaser dissolved the Armstrong big band on August 13, 1947 and established a six-piece small group. This group was called the All Stars, and in 1964 Louis Armstrong recorded his biggest-selling record, Hello, Dolly! He made assorted television appearances, especially in the 1950s and 1960s - the recorded film was a TV Show in Australia when Armstrong was at the peak of his career. Armstrong kept up his busy tour schedule until a few years before his death in 1971. He also toured Africa, Europe, and Asia under sponsorship of the US State Department with great success, earning the nickname Ambassador Satch.

programme.title: Stift Festival
programme.desc: Late August is traditionally the time for the annual Stift International Music Festival. Weerselos Stift Church and Oldenzaals "Hofkerk" serve as venues for wonderful concerts of various young musicians from all over the world. The theme of the 2014 Stift Festival was "Divine and Demonic Passion". Young musicians performed divine and demonic chamber music by composers such as Astor Piazzolla. Piazolla, who combined classical music and tango, created the Nuevo Tango in the 1960s. In this period, he composed a number of tangos inspired on angels. These tangos had a spiritual touch. In the years before his death, Piazzolla used to perform this series of tangos as a single suite, the Suite del √Ångel. This four-tango suite has been performed in several instrumentations. Brava broadcasts the version for bandoneon accompanied by the guitar, violin, double bass, and piano.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Aretha Franklin
programme.sub-title: Aretha Franklin: A trip in Paris
programme.desc: Live Recording at the Palais Des Sports from 1977. Aretha Franklin performs songs like Respect, You make me feel like a natural woman, "La vie en Rose" and Singing in the Rain.

programme.title: Coleman Hawkins live in Belgium, 1962
programme.desc: A jazz festival named after the inventor of the instrument most associated with the genre, Adolphe Sax, would be incomplete without the man who laid the groundwork for how the instrument is played today. This must have been the reasoning of the organizers of the Festival International de Jazz Adolphe Sax in Dinant, Belgium, when they invited tenor saxophone giant Coleman Hawkins to perform there in June 1962. Appearing with a group that includes the French pianist George Arvanitas, one-time Duke Ellington bassist Jimmy Woode, and expat drummer Kansas Fields, the musician also known as "Bean" and "Hawk" serves up an hour-long set of familiar standards bookended by Hank Jones "Chant" and J. J. Johnsons "Wee Dot".

programme.title: BIRDtv
programme.desc: Rotterdams BIRD is a club, cafe and restaurant with a live music programme thats deeply rooted in jazz, and also branches out towards soul, funk, hip-hop and electronic music as well. Its name "BIRD" refers to the nickname of the legendary New York jazz saxophonist, bebop co-founder Charlie Parker (1920-1955). BIRD serves Neapolitan pizzas, good wines, no-nonsense beers and an all-round metropolitan rawness. Since 2014, this urban jazz club and DJAZZ.tv have been collaborating for a series of music programmes: BIRD.tv, allowing you to experience the best BIRD concerts and interviews as from a first row seat! In todays episode Shayna Steele, who can do everything: from background singing with Rihanna via the big Broadway Show on to guest songstress on hit singles by Moby. In order to do so much at once, a versatile voice is a must. And it is exactly this versatility that the American songstress delivers at her concerts, without ever losing the musical direction. From swinging acoustic Samba to storming guitar funk, everything fits like a mould. Presented with a generous portion of charm and impressive dynamic.

programme.title: The Flying Pickets - Dont Turn Around
programme.desc: The Flying Pickets are a British vocal group that was formed in 1982, transferring the art of a cappella to the pop music scene. These five gentlemen scored a number one hit in 1983 in the UK Singles Chart with their version of Only You. Performing live in Stuttgart, vocalists Hereward Kaye, Gary Howard, Michael Henry, Nick Godfrey and Ricky Payne have many surprises in store for their appreciative audience.

programme.title: DJAZZ Portrait
programme.desc: These portraits of artists, concerts and festivals provide a good picture of the jazz world. They are portraits of well-known and less known jazz artists who give us an insight into their lives amongst other things, DJAZZ asked them why they wrote that particular song, what was the first record this musician bought and what his or her most cherished musical memory is. The festival portraits are beautiful reports of the most special jazz festivals and concerts. They revive the festival with the music and experience.

programme.title: Dave Bruberk - Take 5
programme.desc: Embark on a remarkable journey through the world of jazz piano as we showcase some of the most iconic and influential pianists in history. This collection of extraordinary performances captures the unique essence and brilliance of legendary pianists Art Tatum, Thelonious Monk, Bud Powell, and others. Revel in Oscar Petersons virtuosity as his trio plays "C-Jam Blues" in Holbaek, Denmark, on May 2, 1964. Let the sublime artistry of Art Tatum captivate you as he interprets Anton√≠n Dvo≈ô√°ks "Humoresque" in 1953. Discover Thelonious Monks enigmatic genius as his quartet performs his iconic composition "Round About Midnight" in Poland on April 4, 1966. Experience the timeless appeal of the Dave Brubeck Quartets odd-metered "Take Five", recorded live in Brussels, Belgium, on October 10, 1964. Delight in the lyrical beauty of Bud Powells solo performance of "Sweet and Lovely" at the Antibes Jazz Festival of July 13, 1960. Witness the fusion of jazz and funk in Herbie Hancock and The Headhunters exhilarating studio performance of "Sly" in Bremen, Germany, recorded on November 6, 1974. Lastly, enjoy the soulful grooves of Horace Silvers "Song for my Father" performed by his quintet at the Umbria Jazz Festival of July 20, 1976. Tune in and let these legendary jazz pianists transport you on unforgettable musical adventures!

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Chicken
programme.desc: The audience at the Montreal Jazz Festival in Canada was in for a treat on July 3, 1982, as a true musical innovator hit the stage: Jaco Pastorius, who transformed the electric bass into a formidable solo instrument. Combining intricate harmonics, fluid melodies, and unparalleled technical skill, Pastorius left a lasting impact on the music world. In this concert, he is accompanied by Peter Erskine (drums), Don Alias (percussion), Othello Molineaux (steel drums), Bob Mintzer (tenor sax and bass clarinet), and Randy Brecker (trumpet and electronics). They perform "Chicken", "Donna Lee", "Mr. Phone Bone", and "Fannie Mae". Dont miss this extraordinary opportunity to experience Jaco Pastoriuss electrifying performance at the Montreal Jazz Festival 1982!

programme.title: Baden Powell Quartet - Jazz Samba
programme.desc: Recorded in 1971 in Paris, France, Brazilian, classically trained bossa nova guitarist Baden Powell and his quartet play Pai, Lotus (written by Baden Powell), Tristeza (by Haroldo Lobo/Niltinho), Round Midnight (by Thelonious Monk), Nega do cabelo duro (by David Nasser/Rubens Soares), and Aos pes da cruz (by Ze da Zilda/Marino Pinto). Powell is joined by Ernesto Ribeiro-Gon√ßalves on double bass, Helio Schiavo on drums, and Alfredo Bessa on percussion.

programme.title: Paradox Live
programme.sub-title: Paradox Live: Jeroen van Vliet Moon Trio
programme.desc: Innovative contemporary jazz and improvised music, the search for modernity, mind blowing sounds, rock and pop‚Ä¶ Indeed PARADOX Tilburg goes beyond jazz, crossing musical boundaries into the unknown soundscapes of electronic music. Indie artists, blues veterans and jazz superstars all pour their hearts and souls at the Paradox. From young, local talents to top national and international artists, PARADOX Tilburg is the most intimate jazz club in the Netherlands, with a devoted audience from all across Europe. In the TV show PARADOX LIVE you get a taste of the greatest concerts and interviews with artists from all around the world. This episode of PARADOX LIVE presents the amazing Dutch pianist Jeroen van Vliet.

programme.title: Vocal Acrobats
programme.sub-title: Vocal Acrobats: Passion of an Improvised Journey
programme.desc: One vocalist from Paris and the other from Bern, and two contrasting personalities. Brought together by a chance encounter in 2014, the two singers were surprised to discover how much they had in common: they both do more than just sing well. Le√Øla Martial and Andreas Schaerer intend to explore and experiment, stretching their vocal boundaries. From the deepest abyss to the most exquisite tones the human voice can produce, they leave no stone unturned in their quest to express themselves, each in their own individual way and always with a generous dose of humour and zest.

programme.title: Jacob Karlzon Trio - Open Waters
programme.desc: Swedish pianist Jacob Karlzon is joined by Danish bassist Morten Ramsb√∏l and Swedish drummer Rasmus Kihlberg at the Steinway piano factory in Hamburg to present their album Open Waters. Karlzon, a classically trained pianist who shared a stage with Kenny Wheeler, Norma Winstone, and Billy Cobham keeps the rich tradition of Swedish jazz eclecticism alive. Back in 2012, Karlzon explored the world of heavy metal, after that allowing electronic elements to set the pulse.

programme.title: Sarah Vaughan "The Divine One" in 1958
programme.desc: Sarah Vaughan: Live in 58 and 64 features the Divine One in her prime, wrapping her sultry voice around jazz standards such as "Lover Man", "Misty", and "I Got Rhythm" and popular showtunes such as "Over The Rainbow" and "Maria". One of the greatest voices of the 20th Century, her renditions of songs by Harold Arlen, Leonard Bernstein, Johnny Burke, the Gershwins, and Stephen Sondheim are pure diva magic. These three performances demonstrate why Sarah Vaughan is invariably mentioned in the same breath as Ella Fitzgerald and Billie Holiday.

programme.title: Tribute to Django Reinhardt
programme.sub-title: Tribute to Django Reinhardt: Rosenberg meets Beets
programme.desc: World-class Dutch jazz pianist Peter Beets has shared the stage with jazz greats Chick Corea, Wynton Marsalis, "Toots" Thielemans, Elvin Jones, George Coleman, Johnny Griffin, Benny Golson, and John Clayton. His mother a music teacher and his father an Oscar Peterson and Art Blakey enthusiast, Beets was surrounded by music from an early age. And though music was in their blood, neither parent associated the word "musician" with a career. In this broadcast, Peter Beets teams up with gipsy jazz heros Stochelo Rosenberg, Martin Limberger and Frans van Geest. The strength and precision of Van Geests rhythms and tempo, and the ease with which Stochelos lead guitar soars above them, make this band a cohesive collective - unique in their renditions of standards, Djangos classic compositions, and original tunes composed by Stochelo himself.

programme.title: North Sea Jazz Classics
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festivals staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1982, the Superstar Quintet, which consists of the otherworldly American trumpeter Freddie Hubbard, saxophonist Joe Henderson, drummer Tony Williams, bassist Ron Carter, and pianist Kenny Baron performed at the North Sea Jazz Festival in The Hague. The star-studded fivesome put on a concert of cosmic proportions.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Erroll Garner - Live in Singer Concertzaal, Laren
programme.desc: On June 18, 1962, American pianist and composer Erroll Garner performed at the Singer Concertzaal in Laren. The vibrant and joyous concert was played with drummer Kelly Martin and bassist Eddie Calhoun, each long-standing collaborators from Garners trio. The Singer Concertzaal in Laren, the Netherlands is a concert hall and museum dedicated to the preservation of the art collection of American William Henry Singer. It features a variety of artists, both visual and aural.

programme.title: North Sea Jazz Classics
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festivals staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. Back in 1979, legendary American blues guitarist B.B. King gave an unforgettable performance for the audience in The Hague. Born in 1925 in a small town in Mississippi, "Lucille" (as he nicknamed his guitar) helped him escape a miserable existence picking cotton. He arrived in Memphis in the late 1940s, where his cousin Bukka White taught him the tricks of the blues. Soon he developed his own style. Kings virtuoso, narrative solos with lots of vibrato, have been an inspiration for most (rock) guitarists after him.

programme.title: Jim Hall and Atilla Zoller - Extensions
programme.desc: This selection of unforgettable performances by some of the most iconic and influential jazz guitarists in history showcases these legends unique essence. Revel in Wes Montgomerys virtuosity as he performs the captivating "Nicas Dream" in Holland in 1965, and delight in the expressive beauty of his rendition of "Heres That Rainy Day", recorded in London in that same year. Experience the timeless appeal of Joe Passs "You Stepped Out of a Dream" and "You Turned The Tables on Me", recorded live in Hanover in 1975. The interplay between Jim Hall and Atilla Zoller borders on the impossible as they perform "Extensions" in Hanover in 1973. Enjoy Jim Halls lyrical solo performance of "Im Getting Sentimental Over You" from 1964. Witness Sonny Sharrocks avant-garde fusion of jazz and rock in an exhilarating performance of "Peanut", recorded live in France in 1970. Sharrock is joined by flutist Herbie Mann in a soulful performance of "Memphis Underground" from 1969. Immerse yourself in the magic of jazz guitar!

programme.title: Lucky Chops - Live at BIRD
programme.desc: The NYC band Lucky Chops rose to fame when a video of their performance at a subway station went viral on YouTube in 2015. Since then, the energetic quintet has been entertaining audiences all over the world. The band was formed in 2006, when trumpeter Joshua Gawel, saxophonist Daro Behroozi, trombonist Josh Holcomb, tubist Raphael Buyo, and drummer Charles Sams, met during their education at Fiorello H. LaGuardia High School of Music and Art and Performing Arts. Besides touring globally, Lucky Chops also aspires to inspire new generations of musicians by regularly performing at clinics and educational outreaches. In August 2018, they performed their high-energy brassy funk at BIRD, in Rotterdam.

programme.title: Rebirth
programme.desc: Amsterdam, February 6th, 2018 - The short documentary Rebirth in The Amsterdam Red Light District illustrates how brutal Richard Lems life as an addict was and his struggle to unshackle himself from the shame. Filled with fierce, freighting, and sad moments, Richard relives his stabbing, stay in jail, drug test, and drug use. Richard expresses himself verbally but mainly relives the moments through drumming, which renders the documentary an intense and unique experience. Addiction doctor and musician Gerard Alderliefste: "If he dares to bottom out, he will see it was the drugs and not himself. Music can bring those emotions to the surface".

programme.title: Aki Rissanen Trio at Jazzclub Unterfahrt, Munich
programme.desc: Aki Rissanens interest in jazz came after he started taking classical piano lessons. His deep interest in improvised music placed him among top jazz pianist in his home country - Finland. While composing and performing his own music, Rissanen has also collaborated with Verneri Pohjola and Dave Liebman, and today his name appears among the top European jazz musicians. Live from "Jazzclub Unterfahrt" in Munich, Germany, together with Antti Lotjonen on bass and Teppo Makynen on drums, Rissanen showcases the best of Scandinavian jazz and its DNA - the Nordic Tone.

programme.title: MotorMusic
programme.sub-title: MotorMusic: Hamster Axis of the one-click Panther
programme.desc: The MotorMusic Studios in Mechelen, Belgium, attract many great musicians to the city. A wide variety of visiting international jazz musicians share their art of making jazz music with the DJAZZ series Belgium Sessions. In these sessions, some of Europes finest musicians perform their own, original music. This episode features energetic, unpolished jazz with a touch of humour: the young Antwerp band Hamster Axis of the one-click Panther. The quintet showcases its unique sound: smooth yet sometimes deafening jazz with rock influences from their vocalist. The music of "Hamster Axis of the one-click Panther" is wild, unpredictable, swinging, and infectious: in all, the band is everything a good band should be.

programme.title: Classic Meets Jazz
programme.desc: Tzimon Barto, the young American classical pianist and Wolfgang Dauner, the internationally renowned German jazz pianist join their talents to show how multi-dimensional music can be.

programme.title: FS MMA
programme.desc: BodogFIGHT features classic MMA matches involving some of your favorite fighters! Women take the ring in Vancouver, Canada, as Patti Lee brawls Nicdali Calanoc.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: From the Lac Leamy Casino in Gatineau, Quebec, Canada, NABA Light Heavyweight Champion Artur Beterbiev looks to continue his streak of knockout victories and secure a shot at the World Title as he steps into the ring against Isidro Ranoni Prieto (26-1, 22 KOs). Beterbiev, the Russian Olympian and Gold Medalist from the World Championships in Milan, enters the fight with a record of 10-0, not allowing any of his opponents to reach the final bell.

programme.title: FIGHT SPORTS WCK
programme.desc: WCK features intense, nonstop battles in both freestyle kickboxing and Muay Thai from around the world. Its kickboxings most talented athletes at their finest! This episode, from the Martini Plaza in Groningen, the Netherlands, features main event Tayfun Ozcan (Turkey) vs. Mohamed Khamal (Morocco).

programme.title: Fight Sports
programme.desc: The main event in this episode is a battle of fighters who have just one loss to their record, as Ricky Hatton battles Paulie Malignaggi in a light welterweight championship bout that was billed as "Power vs. Precision." Also on the card, future heavyweight champion Tyson Fury battles with Steve Cunningham.

programme.title: FS Grand Sumo
programme.desc: For the first time the top ranked sumo competitors in the world are featured in an action packed series, FIGHT SPORTS GRAND SUMO. This new format presents Sumo in an authentic, in-depth and entertaining way covering the rules, ranks, match-ups, and more. Show 4 featuring Shodai, Takakeisho, Ryuden and Aoiyama from the Aki basho, 2019.

programme.title: Wide World of Fights
programme.desc: Wide World Of Fights includes all styles of fighting from around the world in one show! This episode features a featherweight battle that ends in a brutal knockout between Daniel Ponce De Leon and Antonio Escalante, as well as kickboxing, sumo, arm wrestling and more!

programme.title: Prison Fighters
programme.desc: This series follows former Muay Thai champion Noy Khaopan and American Cody Moberly, two inmates in a Thailand prison, who after seven years are given the chance to fight for their release. By joining a controversial government modern day Prison Fight program, murderers and felons are given the chance to fight for their freedom, and possible redemption, through the ancient tradition of Muay Thai matches.

programme.title: Pariah
programme.desc: Was Sonny Liston murdered? This four-part documentary series explores the life and untimely death of boxing legend Charles "Sonny" Liston, who became the heavyweight champion of the world when he knocked out Floyd Patterson in 1962. Unfortunately, just eight years later, he was found dead in his Las Vegas home from an alleged heroin overdose. Suspicion regarding the real cause of his death has continued to this day.

programme.title: Mega Fights
programme.desc: MEGA Fights are premiere events from the sport of boxing including HBO World Championship Boxing and historic PPV events plus past, current and future World Champions. This episode features Baby Bull, Juan Diaz, (34-2, 17 KOs) battling Paul Malignaggi, aka Magic Man, (26-2, 5 KOs) in a junior welterweight title bout from the Toyota Center in Houston, Texas, USA, on August 22, 2009. Over 7,000 filled the arena for this bout, while another 1.1 million watched on television to see a controversial unanimous decision that quickly caused a rematch to be announced.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: From the historic Royal Albert Hall in London, two of the top female fighters in the world, Natasha Jonas and Lauren Price, will face off to unify world titles in the welterweight division. Jonas is the WBC and IBF World Champion, and has won seven consecutive bouts since a close decision loss to top pound-for-pound fighter Katie Taylor. Lauren Price has won her first eight professional bouts to start her career since winning the Olympic Gold Medal for the UK in 2020, and recently captured the WBA title in the division. Now the two will meet to determine the top fighter in the division and to unify the titles, when Natasha Jonas faces Lauren Price, only on FIGHT SPORTS.

programme.title: Judo for the World
programme.desc: Judo has become one of the most popular sports in the world, it is the Olympic sports practiced by millions of people. Its aim is not only to be a competitive athletic skill, but to be mental and physical education, and to create a better society by developing the true values of sports. Judo for the World presents top competitors and various competitions around the globe, most prominent stories and fascinating events in the world of Judo.

This episode features former Middleweight Champion Jermain "Bad Intentions" Taylor (27-2, 17 KOs) in a back and forth battle with Jeff ""Left Hook Lacy (24-1, 17 KOs) in a WBC Super Middleweight Title Eliminator on November 15, 2008 from the Vanderbilt University Memorial Gymnasium in Nashville, Tennessee, USA.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: MEGA Fights are premiere events from the sport of boxing including HBO World Championship Boxing and historic PPV events plus past, current and future World Champions. This episode features undefeated Andre Berto (21-0, 18 KOs) battling Miguel Angel Rodriguez, aka Miki, (29-2, 23 KOs)i for the vacant WBC Welterweight Title from the FedEx Forum in Memphis, Tennessee, USA on June 21, 2008. Bonus coverage includes Chris "The Nightmare" Arreola (23-0, 21 KOs) vs. Chazz Witherspoon (23-0, 15 KOs).

programme.title: FIGHT SPORTS WCK
programme.desc: WCK features intense, nonstop battles in both freestyle kickboxing and Muay Thai from around the world. Its kickboxings most talented athletes at their finest! This episode, from the Lotto Arena in Antwerp, Belgium, features main event Errol "The Bonecrusher" Zimmerman (The Netherlands) vs. Nidal Bchiri (Morocco). Bonus coverage includes Wail Karroumi vs Lofogo Sarour and Chahid Oulad El Hadj vs Nordin Van Roosmalen.

programme.title: Fight Sports
programme.desc: The main event in this episode is the undefeated Keith Thurman facing off with Orlando Lora. A left hook and right uppercut combination ends this fight. Also on the card, action from former heavyweight champion James Kirkland.

programme.title: FS Grand Sumo
programme.desc: For the first time the top ranked sumo competitors in the world are featured in an action packed series, FIGHT SPORTS GRAND SUMO. This new format presents Sumo in an authentic, in-depth and entertaining way covering the rules, ranks, match-ups, and more. Show 1 featuring Takakeisho, Hakuho, Hokutofuji and Tamawashi from the Kyushu basho, 2019.

programme.title: Wide World of Fights
programme.desc: This episode features a super middleweight brawl between top contenders Adonis Stevenson and Jesus Gonzales that includes a Knockout of the Year candidate, as well as kickboxing, sumo, arm wrestling and more!

programme.title: Prison Fighters
programme.desc: This series follows former Muay Thai champion Noy Khaopan and American Cody Moberly, two inmates in a Thailand prison, who after seven years are given the chance to fight for their release. By joining a controversial government modern day Prison Fight program, murderers and felons are given the chance to fight for their freedom, and possible redemption, through the ancient tradition of Muay Thai matches.

programme.title: Fight Sports MMA
programme.desc: The 16th Annual Fighters Only World MMA Awards are back this month on FIGHT SPORTSR, hosted again by one of the most entertaining personalities in MMA, Chael Sonnen and taking place at the Theater at the Virgin Hotels in Las Vegas. The event has become an annual tradition to honor the best fighters and moments in MMA over the previous year, including awards for male and female Fighter of the Year, Knockout of the Year, Fight of the Year, and many, many more. Appearances by UFC President Dana White, UFC Light Heavyweight Champion Alex Pereira, and the legendary Mark Coleman, to name a few, highlight one of the biggest nights of the year in the world of MMA. Its the 16th Fighters Only World MMA Awards, only on FIGHT SPORTSR.

programme.title: Edu valem

Spordidirektorit Billy Beanei ja tema meeskonda Oakland Athletics tabavad uksteise jarel valusad kaotused. Halvimast paasemiseks v√µtab Billy kasutusele aarmuslikud abin√µud ja ta palkab toole Yalei ulikooli kasvandikust matemaatikageeniuse Peteri. Statistilisi arvutusi tehes j√µutakse koos uskumatu jarelduseni, mis viib senise pesapallimangu filosoofia taiesti uuele tasandile. Kuuele Oscarile kandideerinud linateos p√µhineb Michael Lewise 2003. aastal ilmunud bestselleril. Filmi on lavastanud kahekordne Oscari nominent Bennett Miller ("Capote", "Rebasepuudja"). Peaosas on kahekordne Oscari v√µitja Brad Pitt ("Tahtede poole", "√úkskord Hollywoodis").

programme.title: Kas sa suudad mulle iial andestada?
programme.desc: USA 2018 krimikomoodia, draama Lavastaja: Marielle Heller Osades:Melissa McCarthy, Richard E. Grant, Dolly Wells Tempokas ja m√µnusa huumoriga vurtsitatud kirjanduslik maiuspala p√µhineb t√µsielu sundmustel, mis viivad meid New Yorki aastal 1991. Autor Lee Israel toob leiva lauale kuulsate ja vahem kuulsate, kuid markimisvaarsete isikute biograafiate kirjutamisega. Paraku ei paku tema teemavalikud enam kirjastustele huvi ning tal on raskusi elatise teenimisega. Kuid napsulembese naise viskipudelid ootavad taitmist, uur maksmist ja kassi loomakliiniku arved tasumist. Israel hakkab toekama sissetuleku nimel oma kirjutamisannet kasutama kuulsate autorite isiklike kirjade v√µltsimiseks. Alustades vaiksematest ja suututest kirjakestest j√µuab ta peagi suuremate paladeni, mis aratavad omas valdkonnas jarjest suuremat tahelepanu ning palvivad markimisvaarseid summasid. Kui kaua aga suudab v√µltskirjade autor pettust varjata?

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummon is a writer, photographer, ranch wife and mother of four. She is the host of cooking show The Pioneer Woman. She cooks in a simple, easy to follow way at her ranch in Pawhuska, Oklahoma. We can learn new techniques and get new ideas in a down to earth way and feed even big families every day with dishes that are both yummy and healthy. It is surprisingly easy to cook following her recipes step by step. Her passion for cooking is appreciated by more than 22 million of people all over the world.

programme.title: Beat Bobby Flay
programme.desc: Beat Bobby Flay is an exciting American Cooking show in which two contestants create mouth watering dishes in competition with each other, for the chance to go head to head with the one and only Bobby Flay himself. Flay gets to pick one key ingredient that the contestants must use before the winner is decided by guests of the show. The winner of the first round must then beat Flay in a 45 minute round. The overall winner is then decided by a panel of celebrity judges. So the question is, who can beat the Flayster?

programme.title: Kook
programme.desc: Join chefs Sunny Anderson, Jeff Mauro, Marcela Valladolid as well as chef Katie Lee and Iron Chef Geoffrey Zakarian as they show you how to make simple and delicious meals for your friends and family, while also having lots of fun together in The Kitchen. With interesting and easy recipes, incredible guests, and hilarious hosts and their amazing interaction, you will enjoy this cooking-themed talk show.

programme.title: Bakers Dozen
programme.desc: The bakers decorate oversized doughnuts. Guest judge Gemma Stafford challenges the three finalists to create the ultimate breakfast dessert.

The overall winner is then decided by a panel of celebrity judges. So the question is, who can beat the Flayster?

programme.title: Farmhouse Rules
programme.desc: Join American chef Nancy Fuller in one of New York States favourite farmhouse kitchens as she explores the delights of scratch cooking with fresh local produce. With ingredients sourced from Hudson Valleys finest, Fuller is no stranger to serving up family-friendly meals with a drizzle of luxury and a second-helping of some of the best home-cooked food youll find in the States. Hosted from the comfort of her own kitchen, Fullers beautiful 17th-century farmhouse offers the perfect backdrop. With step-by-step instructions on how to prepare everything from the everyday dinner to a collection of timeless seasonal favourites; breakfast, lunch and dinner have never felt so indulgent.

programme.title: Chopped
programme.desc: Chopped is an American reality cooking TV game show hosted by Ted Allen. Four chefs compete against each other. At the beginning of each round they receive a basket containing four mystery ingredients and are expected to create the best three-course meal using every single one of them. Each round has a time limit. The dishes are judged based on their presentation, taste and creativity. At the end of every round one chef is "chopped" from the competition with no prize. The winner can get up to $50.000.

programme.title: Veidrad toidud
programme.desc: Travel and cuisine documentary series, hosted by famous Andrew Zimmern, American culinary expert, chef, restaurateur and television personality and spin-off series of Bizarre Foods, focuses on classic, iconic foods (not bizarre like in the original series) from some well-known destinations- moussaka and real Greek yogurt from Athens, sweet macarons and crepes from Paris, Italian gelato, gooey fondue to Swiss chocolate from Zurich, mile-high pastrami sandwiches and bagels from NYC, and many other legendary foods. The show will explore where these dishes came from, how theyre prepared, and the best way to enjoy them. Andrew will also discover some secrets and interesting stories behind these epic meals.

programme.title: Ciao House
programme.desc: Hosts Alex Guarnaschelli and Gabe Bertaccini welcome ten chefs to the Tuscan villa where they will live, cook and prove their skills with Italian cuisine.

programme.title: Ciao House
programme.desc: The chefs learn how to make scratch-made pasta from authentic Italian nonnas. Tempers flare during a team-based pasta challenge.

programme.title: Ciao House
programme.desc: Girls Vs Boys. The chefs travel to a Tuscan vineyard where they are challenged to create a three-course menu incorporating truffles and wine pairings.

programme.title: Ciao House
programme.desc: The chefs meet a butcher whose family business is over three centuries old! Plus, they create a menu based around the Bistecca alla Fiorentina.

programme.title: Next Baking Master
programme.sub-title: Like A Fine Wine And Cheese
programme.desc: Like A Fine Wine And Cheese. The final four shop for a dessert spotlighting cheese. Next, after a lesson from a sommelier, the competitors create desserts featuring alcohol.

programme.title: Bakers Dozen
programme.desc: Im Not Basic. The bakers begin by decorating oversized sugar cookies. Later, the three finalists must make extravagant surprise cakes for guest judge Robert Lucas.

programme.title: Girl Meets Farm
programme.desc: Molly Yeh is a cookbook author who combines her country lifestyle with her Jewish and Chinese heritage to create the most delicious new dishes. A former big city girl, Yeh is multi talented, a successful blogger and classically trained musician, its food that ultimately stole her heart. Learn lots of tricks and tips with Yeh as she cooks up her personal favourite recipes for every occasion, from family visits to brunch with the girls to a classic farm supper! This show is an absolute treat.
